keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Confidence slipped to 98.6 this month after rising to 103.5 in September, and a home prices index rose 5.1 percent in August, after gaining in July.

headline.print_headline: Public Confidence Slips, but Home Prices Climb
headline.main: Consumer Confidence Slips, but Home Prices Continue to Climb

snippet: Confidence slipped to 98.6 this month after rising to 103.5 in September, and a home prices index rose 5.1 percent in August, after gaining in July....
abstract: Conference Board reports consumer confidence slipped from 103.5 in September to 98.6 in October, reflecting drop in consumer assessment of business conditions and employment prospects; economists say shrinking inventory is reason for rise in home prices, as indicated by August Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index, despite shrinking consumer confidence.
